website_summaries.verdict: With its smart design and sturdy construction, this is a solid choice in drying racks.
pros: Adjustable – it can be used to dry just a few things or expand to hold more items
This feature also makes it good for longer clothing items
Users love the large size and some report that this model holds up well over time
cons: A few users had issues with this model rusting, and some experienced problems when adjusting (such as arms not staying up)

customer_reviews.title: Used and dirty!
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the packaging is it’s filthy! This should have been new and its obviously used! There was rust on the metal and dirty markings on the plastic. My cat was even picking up a scent on it. I’m very unhappy with this order
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: The drying rack was covered in rust
customer_reviews.text: The whole drying rack was covered in rust when we opened the box. At first I thought it is just red dirt or stht. Then I tried clean it with wet wipes - nothing, then I tried clean it with Mr. Clean - again nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Sa_Ni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small apartment!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I live in a studio apartment in NYC, so I don't have much space. This dryer is sturdy an stable, offers a lot of room for both clothes and shoes. It folds down very compactly. It's not very large, each wing can be positioned at different angles and can independently fold down. Very helpful if you don't have that much clothes to dry, and you want to save space. It's light enough to carry in one hand. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcela Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and holds a lot of clothes!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: My cats now view it as their own personal fort and use the sweater drying part as a hammock. It's sturdy enough to hold a 13 lb. cat, so it works really well and holds a lot of clothes. I bought it to replace our old accordian drying rack and am not disappointed. It fits just as much if not more clothes as before and the clothes dry just as fast. When folded, it fits very neatly next to the washer and dryer so I can put it away between washes. It was easy to set up, even without directions, so I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: fashionista student

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! AWESOME! Best drying rack ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This drying rack is AMAZING!!!! The item arrived promptly and well packaged. There is no assembly necessary and it easily folds and unfolds with no difficulty. It folds closed like a lawn chair and is even thinner when collapsed, making it super easy to store this is a small laundry area. The quality of this rack is really impressive, especially given the price and what individual racks sell for. This is like 6 racks in one and is highly versatile. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Broken: Snapped tines, shoddy manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I bought the "Folding X-frame" model and it arrived broken. The metal tines were poorly soldered and had snapped off the frame. I realize many sellers will chalk this up to UPS - "not our fault; the carrier did it" - but if your metal product is so flimsy it snaps during shipment, it is a bad product. I ordered a set of hook-over-the-balcony drying racks as a replacement. They haven't arrived yet, but fingers crossed for quality the second time.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Fab for those without a dryer
customer_reviews.text: First one was damaged in transit, but we received another right away. It takes up a lot of space when in use, so keep that in mind. However, I love everything else about it. We recently moved off-grid and don't have a dryer. If I had room, I would've gotten two! I hang entire loads of laundry you on it and haven't had a thought about it not being able to handle it. It folds up very close to flat and easily fits against the wall. The mesh piece in the middle is a bit odd, I'd rather have more bars. But I use it for socks and undies. Overall, this thing rocks.
customer_reviews.author: T. Agnew

customer_reviews.title: Design is nice, but arrived with rust and a dent.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old drying rack, because it was on its last legs. I love the design of this new drying rack, because it folds down easily and even has a place to dry shoes. It seems to take up less space when put away, but it’s trifold design offers more drying room. I don’t love that it arrived with one of the bars bent and several rust spots. I don’t know how a tightly wrapped, New product got rust, but that is what I was sent. What a huge disappointment as the design is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Kidman

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo where clotheslines aren't allowed, but I prefer air-drying my clothes. Thus, this rack was a great solution. It folds and unfolds easily (I'm saying this as a person with arthritis - if it's easy for me to maneuver, anyone can), and can be maneuvered into different shapes, depending on your needs. It also hides away neatly behind my bushes for easy access!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna M

customer_reviews.title: Totally amazing drying rack
customer_reviews.text: We were sick of old drying rack that was constantly falling when you put clothes up. This one is amazing super easy to open up and setup and feels really sturdy. My only complain is that it takes up more room that our older rack when opened up, its wide; but I think thats adds to the stability so I am happy with it. Overall super satisfied with the drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Nirav Sheth

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for ways to keep electric costs low, be a little more eco friendly, and make sure my clothes last as long as possible, so it's rare that I use my dryer. Previously I used the more traditional accordion-style drying racks, but always needed more room and was annoyed by how easily they'd collapse when full. I'm so glad I found this style. It is lightweight and easy to collapse (when you want it to!) and holds a TON. Like, mind blowing amounts of laundry. By far worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: DHenn

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is the best drying rack on the planet. It is very versatile, it's strong yet lightweight. It can be put in countless positions for whatever you are drying, you can hook hangers on it for clothes you want to dry on the hanger, and the bottom shelf for laying sweaters, etc. is perfect. It is easy to set up and take back down, and I have mine hanging on the back of the laundry room door where it is out of the way. You will love this rack.
customer_reviews.author: P. Btica

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived broken in two spots. I think it will still function fine, but this could decrease the overall life.
customer_reviews.author: lissa

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I chose this item because it was one of the most affordable in its category. It can hold a lot of clothes, but not as many as other racks - the sweater shelf is nice to have (if you only need to flat-dry one sweater at a time) but I would rather have more regular bars. I can't see myself using the shoe dryers more than once a year so I'm glad they are removable. The construction is definitely a little cheap - one of the plastic arms securing the main A-frame broke within a few uses, but the rack still stays up without it. I would've preferred those arms to be metal.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna G

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This rack is so functional! There is space for 17 items to be hung on the top rack alone. I love it! No more hanging clothes on a regular rack and trying to find space. This solves that problem. You can also use clothes pins for smaller items; they fit perfectly on the bars. It is very sturdy, too (made of lightweight aluminum). I can’t say enough about this rack. It is well made and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: kso52999

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and big, but folds up.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy. I just ordered a second one. I fell in my laundry room (slipped on spilled liquid detergent), grabbed hold of this drying rack, and it totally broke my fall. I should have slammed my head on the floor, but I fell less hard and only landed on my behind and shoulder. The rack was slightly bent afterward, but I’m sure it saved my life! I thought it would come crashing to the floor but it didn’t. I made sure I replaced it with the very same one. I love the size—it holds more than any other drying rack! And it folds up, so you don’t have to have tons of room if you fold it in between uses.
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN A BOHMANN

customer_reviews.title: I finally caved
customer_reviews.text: For the last couple of months, I've been hanging items that have to air dry like fabric masks wherever I can find space around the house. I got tired of the way my house would look after doing laundry, so I finally caved and bought this. This drying rack is larger than I expected, but it fold down nicely and I can put it behind my laundry room door. This rack will also come in handy now that we're in sweater season and some of those need to be air dried too.
customer_reviews.author: xriariceex

customer_reviews.title: Great size but rusty metal
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would be a great clothing rack, big size and all the bells and whistles advertised in the posting. However, it came to me in a shredded box that I wouldn't be able to ship back without using a roll of tape and the metal is rusted as shown in the picture above. I don't understand how it came to me wrapped but covered in rust. It's a shame because the size and everything else is great but it's hard to justify drying my clothes on rusted metal. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: joanne

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried several different drying racks, and out of them all this one is a nice surprise. Reasonably priced, it is ideal for anyone with limited space for drying their laundered clothes. Used it right out of the box. Easy to unfold and refold for storage. The coated wires are perfectly spaced and as long as you remember to balance the load on the rack as clothes are hung on it, there is plenty of space for the clothes. Summary - good quality, great product, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good rack overall
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this rack for 3 months now and overall, I’m very happy with it. I use it very regularly (at least on a weekly basis) and it performs very well for my needs. There’s a lot of surface area and the varsitily even allows to hang clothes with hangers when/if desired. The only thing I’m not satisfied with and the reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is the mesh sweater shelf. I use it weekly and it’s not as durable or strong. But, overall, this is still a very good drying rack so I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: micbook

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drying rack, I'm extremely pleased with it. The arms can be raised to varying heights to accommodate different types of clothing. Or one could raise only one side if they only have a few items to dry. You really can fit a lot of wet clothes on this rack and they seem to dry fairly quickly. The drying rack easily opens, closes, and adjusts. When I'm done I fold it up and slide it in next to my washing machine. Great purchase, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BettyCat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be my favorite purchase of the year. I air dry most of my clothes, so needed a rack, but always thought the typical accordion design was faulty and not ideal. The shape of this one is brilliant and holds so many more items, plus the way it neatly folds up when not in use makes it easy to tuck away out of sight. I'm buying one now for a friend who saw this in my house and had to know where I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Miss G

customer_reviews.title: Despite being big, has surprisingly little amount of hanging space
customer_reviews.text: This thing is much larger than I expected, so make sure you pay attention to the dimensions if you live in a small space. Despite being so large, there isn't a whole lot of space on this thing to hang/dry clothes. I find it's filled up before I've even hung up half my load of laundry to dry. It is fairly easy to set up, but every time I try to fold it back down, poles come loose and the the whole thing falls apart. I feel like you might as well save some money and get a cheaper product. It probably would serve the same purpose as this one. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Mcaninch

customer_reviews.title: This is really great for laundry... and an impromptu outdoor work station!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this has been perfect for me. I love how easy it is to store, the sturdiness of the frame, and it offers plenty of drying space for my delicates, wool socks, and the occasional yoga pants or top. I love the flat-dry space for items, too. Have only tried the shoe drying elements once with my giant hiking boots. They weren't quite cut out for that, but I didn't expect so. (It was better than nothing, all the same). Mostly I'm posting this review, because I've twice now used the rack as an easy outdoor standing desk solution (see pic). It's pretty versatile, and since it's easy to stow away, I'm just extra delighted.
customer_reviews.author: mmcfarland

customer_reviews.title: After 3 weeks of LIGHT USE BROKEN
customer_reviews.text: I have literally only used this for drying less than a dozen loads of laundry and it is already broken. Sadly, it is exactly 32 days later, 2 days past the return policy, and I am stick with a piece of junk. If it has broken this much already, imagine how long it will last before it is completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cinnamon

customer_reviews.title: Broke our dryer so this is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Its been extremely hot here in Cali, and we some how managed to bust our new dryer, so I suggested this rack! It doesn't fit vert cozy, and sometimes the arms fall down even when there isn't much weight on it, but I like it. We keep it in the garage (it's also windy out and I don't want my underwear flying away!) and it's been so warm the garage gets unpleasantly hot. It holds things just fine usually, airs them out, and voila! I can't stand how for some reason my freshly washed clothes get "crispy" when they aren't dryed with the dryer tho. Gotta figure out how to fix that!
customer_reviews.author: Arielle O.

customer_reviews.title: Large space needed to set it up, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack! Very sturdy and it holds a lot of clothing pieces. It’s super easy to set up, literally pull it out of box and fold it out..done! The only thing that’s not even negative, but know you will need some space to set it up in. I did read the dimensions before I bought it but didn’t realize how much space it does take up. The fact that it folds easily back flat is easy for storage. It’s a great design, so much better than the old ones. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda wales

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it began to snap
customer_reviews.text: Loved this drying rack until one of the wings began to show signs of wear, and ultimately is going to snap soon. I've only had it for a few months and don't use it very often, so the heavy duty-ness is a little suspect.
customer_reviews.author: Kadie I.

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend to buy this product. It is extremely unstable, couple of times it fell. Not enough room for one load.
customer_reviews.author: Tetiana Morozova

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for me to dry all my synthetic sports wear that shouldn't go in the dryer. Not sure why it would be good for small spaces aside from the fact it folds up to put away. It's quite large when open. I don't use the mesh net for drying but my cat loves to lay in it while I'm hanging the laundry. It's not quite strong enough to support that much weight but a few safety pins added to the Velcro make it work perfect. Would absolutely recommend as the best choice for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed. Big enough for a load of clothes. *****
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I read a lot of reviews here on amazon. Vascillated between this one and a cheaper one. Went with the reviews and got this one. Had it on the back porch with a ton of clothes on it. Brought it back in to dry the last little bit. It’s big. And awkward to carry around when it’s open, but it’s designed well and feels sturdy. It closes and opens easily.
customer_reviews.author: M. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived rusted- doesn't say much for its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Very good hang dryer.
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to start hang drying my clothes for multiple reasons, and I really love this hanger. It folds up small, and is easy to unfold and fold back. It holds a lot of clothes and I like that there’s a spot to lay something flat, and to have something to put wet shoes on. It works great and fits in my tiny room. I’d definitely get it if you’re looking for a good hang dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This comes fully assembled. It folds open and closed easily. The wings rise, and then are held up by attached supports that you swing into place under the wings - an excellent design. I've loaded it about 3/4 full twice so far with wet laundry, and the wings have held the weight without issues. You can lower one wing and take up less space, but the horizontal design takes up more space than the vertical, accordion-fold types of racks. The advantage of this design is that you don't have items hanging on top of each other. It folds flat, so you can stash it behind something when closed. If you have the space, I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small portable washer and this rack will hold 3 loads of clothes. It is easier to unfold and fold back down for storage. Plenty of room and everything dries by morning. I am on a fixed income and our slum lord charges an arm and a leg for the washer and dryer. My son bought me a portable washer and I got this drying rack. Best investment ever.
customer_reviews.author: LauraJ

customer_reviews.title: Isn’t as strong as it should be
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for the price I paid , I expected it to be more stronger , it’s very light weight and moves around easily , I had one before where it was more durable / stronger but this one . It’s ok
customer_reviews.author: Alla

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t use a cloths dryer, you need this.
customer_reviews.text: If you dry cloths without a dryer and you don’t have a lot of space you need this! It’s completely assembled, you take it out of the box and there you go. I store ours right up against the wall behind our cloths hamper. When I’m using it, I make our bed then set it up on there. There are numberous creative ways to get more cloths on it. The more you use it, the more ideas you come up with. It’s now a necessity in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Good job
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of clothes. We have a potty training toddler and no drier for the time being so got this as our second drying rack. Trumps the one that we’ve had for years. Things seem to dry faster but I wouldn’t say it’s compact. You have to put it away. Not something you’re going to keep out of you’re limited on space if that is a thing for you. It does the job. I’m happy. No craziness in packaging or rust that others have experienced and I would be unhappy with that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gieszl

customer_reviews.title: solid, but tightening mechanisms feel like they're going to become un-useable after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times now, and overall it works great, has a larger capacity than my previous drying rack, but the locking mechanism that you tighten to be able to put weight on the arms is plastic, and i've already scuffed it up a few times tightening it with a screwdriver. Afraid it'll get to the point in the not so distant future where I won't be able to adjust the arms anymore.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great for drying clothes inside.
customer_reviews.text: I always needed a way to dry my clothes on rainy days. I have washed my clothes, hung them on the line and before they got dry, it started to rain. I usually brought them inside and hung them over chairs and a basket. But his hang rack helps tremendously. I lift the hangers, fold the clothes over the bars, turn on the fan, and then the clothes finish drying. This is a great help on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dryman

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup for a Dryer
customer_reviews.text: I got the inspiration to buy this when I had my dryer develop problems and I recalled using something like this in Germany. This is a great back up for a dryer. I put in in the space between the wall and the machine when I’m not using it. So once my dryer is repaired it won’t be in the way, yet will be around if the dryer breaks again.
customer_reviews.author: jhkjh

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy side bars
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this rack when I first got it. But after using it for 5 or six loads of wash it just gave way on one side. I have been careful to not overload it. Now I have to use it with the support arms out as far from the middle as possible. Otherwise, it's a great concept. I will check out the warranty as I only had it three weeks when it collapsed.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lovely addition for laundry
customer_reviews.text: The dryer for my apartment building sucks at the whole drying part so I ended up buying this and absolutely love it. Air drying is better on your pockets and the environment so win-win. This portable rack is lightweight and easy to carry around. Its also easy to adjust the size and it is STURDY! My jeans, blankets, and shirts couldn't bring this down so thats good
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre quality and dirty upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe the other reviews about the rust/brown residue on the bars upon opening, but it's true. Most of it wiped off, but some still remains. Very strange. Product is just OK...the bars that lock the unit in place when opened are a cheap plastic and I could see them breaking in a few months. Overall I would skip and get something a little nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: If you have an entire room to devote to drying laundry then this is perfect for you
customer_reviews.text: This thing is comically large. It holds a lot of stuff but I'm serious, it takes up the whole living room. If you have an entire room to devote to drying laundry then this is perfect for you; I do not, and so this takes up waaaaaay too much room. It's totally my fault, the dimensions are right there in the description. But I have no spatial recognition so I didn't realize that this drying rack would be the size of my car. That said, it does hold like a million things.
customer_reviews.author: agentM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed UNIT RUSTY
customer_reviews.text: Sad, had to return, the unit was RUSTED so much. I was really disappointed. returning was quite easy, no hassle. Wish I could have been guaranteed that I could order another one and get it delivered this year, as we returned to be camp hosts again and we really need this because we are not close to laundramats.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi - G-ma

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give it a better rating....
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy, nice white coating , but unlike the rack I replaced, the arms that hold the racks up on each side, are so short, it’s impossible to hang anything long or on hangers, they drag on the ground. Sides to not raise further than a T shape. So useless for using as I hoped hanging clothes on hangers on it.
customer_reviews.author: D'Lynne

customer_reviews.title: great quality, very durable, tons of space for more than one load of wash at a time!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this drying rack! It's a bit more than one you may find in stores, but let me tell you it's worth every penny! It has a TON of room, and even comes with 2 spots for shoes to dry from. It is VERY sturdy/durable. I usually set it outside to let my clothing dry in the sun, and easily fold it back up again and slide it into my closet!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good if you need a clothes drying rack
customer_reviews.text: When I moved i learned that my 12 year old dryer wouldn't fit into the washer/dryer closet and open. So, for 4 months I hung all the laundry to dry on the deck. This rack worked well, however it didn't work as well as the super cheap ikea rack which was a bummer. I had a few bent bars the first week. Nothing got worse as I was using it, but none of those weak looking wire rack pieces bent on the ikea rack. So, this was good, but I would probably but a different one. The bend wire may have happened in shipping, but I was impressed how not strong this 'heavy duty' rack was.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drying rack, it feels high quality, and it probably has enough space for most. Unfortunately, it doesn't have enough space for what I need to dry at the same time (eight shirts and four jeans). It has enough room for all that, but everything kind of gets in the way of each other, and there would be wet spots everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: This year my 14 year old daughter bought so many clothes for school that are hang or lay flat to dry. This rack is perfect. It is not heavy, can be folded and stored and can be set up and taken down in seconds. I hang over the bars, hang hangers or even lay some things across the bars. Very convenient, light but sturdy when set up, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, durable, light. Love the wet shoe holder.
customer_reviews.text: Great for drying freshly laundered clothing, and shoes. Perfect size. I do not fold it between uses although the option to fold in the side flaps is nice for when needing to make little more room in the area where it is stored. Very light so easy to move around as needed. Have had for a few months. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best drying rack!  No more flimsy racks for me.
customer_reviews.text: Great drying rack. Very sturdy. Holds quite a lot of garments. Easily slides to the side of the washer/dryer for storage when not in use. Much better than the flimsy drying racks.
customer_reviews.author: tgcalif

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy, tips over
customer_reviews.text: This works indoors just fine, but i like drying clothes outdoors in the sun to kill off any mold and bacteria. If theres even the slightest breeze, this entire apparatus will tip over and fall. Ive put bricks on the bottom stand to keep it upright, and it still falls over in the wind. Ive had to collect my clothes from our backyard grass countless times. Not a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORK PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy clothes hanger! I had over 20 items on this clothes hanger and when I woke up, it was all dry. Bought it to go with my Panda portable washer bc I live in a apartment & do not want to use the general laundry room in my building bc of COVID. So this was very much needed & work so well!
customer_reviews.author: RedPrada00

customer_reviews.title: Good design, hope to improve quality
customer_reviews.text: After half year using, I come back to comment some good things and bad things about this hanger. First , it still can hang my clothes and put some weight. Second, the plastic part started to broke. (Leak) third, there are many rust between joints. I understand that it already used for half year, but I hope a better quality product for this price. Finally, the design of the product is very useful. I can put Muti stuff on it such as shoes , hat or food.
customer_reviews.author: Superman

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Love this drying rack so much! We had the other kind that constantly collapsed and didn’t dry close to as many clothes. The little attachment to dry shoes snap off really easily but hold on to them as they are very useful for hanging women’s lingerie and masks. You can dry a LOT of items on this rack. If size is an issue, you can just open up one side of it.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen K.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Design 👎
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 5 drying racks from Amazon. I returned this one right away because the construction is very crappy and flimsy. It will not endure over time. I do not recomend this product and I'm surprised to see it as an Amazon Choice.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Best Drying rack!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing drying rack that folds up into a compact size that makes it easy to put away. I love how it has the adjustable arms to allow for the "wings" to be different angles or even allows for only one wing to be up at a time if necessary. This is the best way to dry longer clothing items like dresses or jeans without folding them in half over a shower curtain rod. I use it multiple times per week and look forward to saving my clothes and to saving on electricity costs!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Rusty Bars and Paint
customer_reviews.text: Hello Everybody - This is the second time i am buying this product ( i bought one 3 yrs ago and it worked perfectly fine ). I ordered this rack thinking that it will be the same, but i was wrong. The product came with Rusty Bars and Paints worn out in different places ( not sure if you can see the pain worn out, but if you look closely, you can see the Rust in the Bar).I really don't know if i can send this back to Amazon. For the first time, i feel that i have been let down by amazon :(
customer_reviews.author: Karthik R

customer_reviews.title: Saves money on electric bill!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this to start using my dryer less in hopes of lowering the utilities bill. It actually worked. And a bonus is, the fresh laundry gives the house a really good scent! It holds a whole load of clothes in my household (2 people, 1 big basket we use) and we haven't run into any issues with it. It folds up and we put it away against a wall. It's really easy and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Salena

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought two, only because it would allow me to dry multiple loads of laundry. The rack is easy to setup and easy to take down to store. So if you need a little extra drying area, or don’t want to use a dryer for smaller loads, this is a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought an all metal clothes drying rack at Costco for $20 and was looking for something similar. This is the closest thing that comes to the construction and price. The all metal racks here on Amazon are close to $50. This compromises with a mesh drying shelf for undergarments. Pretty sturdy construction given that the cross bars are plastic with the mesh shelf. Folding it isn't as easy or sturdy as an all metal drying rack, so just be delicate when folding it. It folds slim so it fits perfectly in my storage closet.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrick

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: Saves energy! I can fit a load for 2 on this rack. It takes all day to dry, but who's in a hurry? I use an outdoor clothesline during the warm months, so it's a bit hard to get used to running the dryer again and seeing the sticker shock on the electric bill. This is a perfect solution. It doesn't take up much space while in use and stores easily between uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Holds so much clothes! I love this drying rack and the gullwing style because I feel that it's better for holding larger loads of laundry and spreading them out to help dry faster. I'm obsessed with the mesh layer on the bottom that helps dry out sweaters or shirts. Very easy to set up. Would definitely recommend. Save energy and help your clothes last longer!
customer_reviews.author: cocoabutter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I've purchased--one for my apartment, one for my parents' house, and one for our vacation home. It's sturdy, easy to fold and expand, lets the clothing hang to dry in a single layer (unlike some of the accordion-type racks), and gives you a lot of hanging space. I like that there are inserts to dry shoes, as well as a mesh net for drying sweaters.
customer_reviews.author: wl110

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty but nice
customer_reviews.text: I definitely wouldn't say this is heavy duty the folding mechanism is flimsy plastic. It folds out and works well otherwise. I take it camping to dry towels and etc... I use landscaping staples along the bottom to keep the wind from blowing it over.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Best clothes dryer rack I’ve ever own
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being sturdy, it is very easy to fold. I like how there’s no sweat whenever i try to fold/unfold it. From the previous dryer racks I’ve owned before, I will always leave it as it until the next laundry cycle because it is a hassle to fold them. But now that I’ve got to own this, it’s never an issue to fold it once it is empty of clothes.
customer_reviews.author: cvilla

customer_reviews.title: Very good outdoor rack to dry clothes
customer_reviews.text: My last one endured 8 years of outside use. After awhile it got rusty and the parts cracked, but I liked it so much I got another one. I dry all my clothes outside, sheets are too big, I Hang them elsewhere. But it’s a good rack that spreads out enough to do a full load of laundry. It works fine inside too. (I never use the shoe attachment)
customer_reviews.author: TRio

customer_reviews.title: Good Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 hand wash shirts that I lay on this rack, so I don't use it a lot, but have had it for a year. The two wings have positioning bars so you can set them flat or at an angle. I cannot get the shoe horns to stay upright when I put wet shoes on them so I gave it only 4 stars. The bottom middle "rack" is mesh which is nice, but harder to get to than the top two areas. It does take up a large area all unfolded but I have it against a wall and I have plenty of room so it's not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rack!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best design I've ever seen or used of drying racks for clothes. I swear, I can put SO many clothes on this thing, and I'm confident it will stay put and not collapse. I use hangers on both ends to dry my shirts so I have more room, and I can dry at the very least 30 shirts at a time doing it this way. I would recommend this product a hundred times over.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan and Josephine H.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: folds up super easily, doesn't take up too much space when folded. Used in a small space, but takes up a bit of room, make sure you check dimensions. Cons: will occasionally fold in on itself if bottom rod is touched
customer_reviews.author: emfawn

customer_reviews.title: Great hangar to dry clothes.
customer_reviews.text: Good rack for drying the natural way. Has plastic joints so not sure how long it will last if folded regularly but seems sturdy. Seems to have plenty of space and hangars to hang various items. Overall quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fountainhead

customer_reviews.title: Needs bigger area
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use, don’t know how it will last. Big issue for me is the netting bottom to put sweaters is too little. I’m not a big person and my shirt didn’t fit. I would have wanted a bigger area and a second area to dry items flat.
customer_reviews.author: Bellabu

customer_reviews.title: Need to contact seller
customer_reviews.text: I loved this drying rack for the 1 time I actually got to use it - when I received it, it was a little bent/crooked, it didn’t look too bad so I didn’t think anything of it but when I used it, it completely folded, like the legs snapped.. I’m very disappointed and have tried to contact the seller but was unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: happy i purchased
customer_reviews.text: this rack was sturdy and it folds very easy. fits next to my washer when folded. It is a large when open but lots of room for clothes. I generally leave it up over night and take down in the morning so it's not in the way during day. i have a small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: C.Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Fits whole load of clothes
customer_reviews.text: We don’t have a dryer at our place, only a washing machine, so we needed something that could hold our clothes to dry. It fits my whole load of clothes! So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: Came rusty
customer_reviews.text: This is still in the plastic wrap and it already came covered in rust all over. I didn’t pay this much for a product that’s already messed up. How would I expect to hold wet clothes for years when it’s rusty before it’s even out of the plastic wrap?
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Luu

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this at all. Its very narrow, for me large and xl tshirts do not fit on this item without crumpling them up. This is very disappointing as they then dry wrinkled. Fully loaded the "wings" droop rather than arch up, this makes it very difficult to hang longer items on the ends. Honestly there's not much I can say about this thing, it was very disappointing and I believe I have summarized myself very well in few woods.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I needed! I’m in a small apartment and I got tired of paying for community washer/dryer so I bought a tiny washer and this! Absolutely perfect! Fits a lot and it is really sturdy also I can wash my toms and day them with this too I’m extremely excited to keep using it. I saw reviews where it came rusty, I didn’t have that problem but I guess it depends where you’re at? Either way I highly recommend getting this
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: No Warranty Support
customer_reviews.text: The arms on my stand snapped and split within the warranty period. I was unable to find a phone number for support but I did e-mail the company. While I did receive an auto-reply I did not receive any real replies or assistance to my multiple emails.
customer_reviews.author: RachelG

customer_reviews.title: Reliable. Worth the money. Saves dryer costs. Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this drying rack/stand from Honey-Can-Do and it was all what was needed in the warm California weather. Have never used the machine dryer ever since this was delivered. It has many rods to accommodate all the laundry. It is very portable. It is not heavy at all. As a matter of fact, I can carry it with one hand even when it is full of clothes. Even though it is light weight, it is super durable. It is easily foldable and goes right in a corner of my patio. A well worth investment to save machine dryer costs! Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sakerwala H.M.

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drying rack, in fact, this is my second! The full wings allow for different types of laundry, and the design is perfect— it does not become tippy if you overload one side or the other. I bought my first one over 5 years ago, and it is still in pristine condition—no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kooy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna buy a smaller hanger but I gave this one a try since I thought bigger the better. One load of kids' clothes fit just fine. I don't need to find a room to hang I'm glad I decided to go with this one instead of smaller one. Wish it was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: csnmum

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor drying.
customer_reviews.text: This drying rack came out of the box completely put together and ready to use and in perfect condition. It is adjustable and can fit into average or larger spaces, and folded up can easily fit in closet or behind a door and out of sight. I especially like that it has holders to dry shoes. I dry washcloths and towels before putting them in the to-do laundry basket and this works well. I searched a long time before I found what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Big!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as pictured. It’s nice that it folds up small enough to slide next to our washer, but it has significantly more spaces to dry clothes compared with our previous accordion drying rack. It is HUGE when opened, so just make sure you have enough space for it!
customer_reviews.author: Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty short wing-span
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why the "wings" don't angle upwards. Hanging a shirt on a hanger causes the shirt to drag on the floor, and you can forget about hanging pants! I guess it would be okay if all you want to hang are socks and underwear, but even towels drag if they're not folded in half!
customer_reviews.author: T. Fredette

customer_reviews.title: Every home needs one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dryer! Its a little larger than exspected but you have the freedom to angle the sides to take up less space. Its strong yet lightweight. Got here super fast in shipping. We use it when we have loss of power due to storms and camping.
customer_reviews.author: michelle sharp

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this going on 4 years now, and still going! For the first three years, it was used often, as we didn’t have a dryer. It has held up to being used every few days to dry a load, it’s sturdy enough to hang a wet queen size comforter on to dry. It has served us well, and I foresee more years of service to come.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Asch

customer_reviews.title: Plastic piece looks like it may not last.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good purchase for me. I don't dry my clothing & I wanted something I could put away when not in use. This does the trick. The plastic piece that you use to fold it, looks a little flimsy. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: flimsy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product is very lightweight and flimsy. First time I tried to hang out a few tee shirts the wind blew it over before I got back in the house. Might work ok indoors but really not built for outdoors. 5 people found this helpful
customer_reviews.author: sunny c

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack, fits versatile pieces, and big!
customer_reviews.text: Not great for tight spaces, but great if you have a lot of things that you want to hang out to dry. When fully assembled, probably is about 2 ft deep, 3 ft tall and 4.5-5 ft wide. I may wish that there was another layer for drying sweaters, but really loving it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool to make laundry day a lot easier!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had a similar one and I have wanted one for my clothes for a long time. I decided to order this one and am very pleased that I did. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs a place to dry clothes that you don’t want to put in the dryer.t
customer_reviews.author: Sue Parks

customer_reviews.title: Great for hanging up one person-week of laundry.  Folds up very small
customer_reviews.text: The rack folds up into a really small footprint that can be stored vertically and opens up easily. It also just fits through my back-porch door while fully open which is useful for hanging up/taking down clothes indoors without getting eaten by mosquitoes. Overall the size is a tiny bit on the small side for a full week of laundry for a single person, but my wife and I get by by adding some extra hangers on the side for extra shirts and whatnot. To clarify, for the two of us, we need to run two loads each week, each of which fills up the entire rack.
customer_reviews.author: Li Ma

customer_reviews.title: we love this rack
customer_reviews.text: Great rack, easy to put up and put down. Lost a star because the point at where it folds appears to be where they put the cheapest pieces. I like it now, but it doesn't seem like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: S. Young

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy to handle jeans and large towels but I would ...
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy to handle jeans and large towels but I would not call this "heavy duty". The locking hinge on next to the sweater screen is plastic; while it may last a long time this product just does not coincide with my connotation of Heavy Duty. Otherwise Great Product, have used it almost daily. I only wash loads of 17 items because of the # of slots it has.
customer_reviews.author: sfped

customer_reviews.title: Rather flimsy and the braces do not keep it open
customer_reviews.text: I'll be returning this for a refund, the one I received is defective: the locking brace on the legs are loose and also make from soft plastic. So this rack is tippy and not very sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Da Moogs

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I just love this thing. It is sometimes hard to find a spot for it in my small apartment but the clothes dry quickly and I can fold it back up and keep it out of the way. It’s not the most sturdy rack in the world but it’s all that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Defect in product could tear holes in clothes
customer_reviews.text: The product came damaged with some sharp metal edges in an area where my drying clothes are likely to contact. The sharp edges will definitely damage my clothes so I will not be using this product as is. I've tried to reach out to the seller for a replacement but no response after over 1 week. If you get lucky and the product isn't damaged, this might be a good product. However, I will be returning if I don't hear back from the seller soon about my defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moy

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete product
customer_reviews.text: While I do like the product, it deserves a negative review since it came incomplete. It was missing the bars on the bottom portion leaving me with less options to hang items. I am now hanging items around the house on the furniture so I am dissatisfied. The purpose of this was to have everything drying in one area and leave the rest of the home to serve its actual function. Before I realized, I had already recycled the package and had nothing to send it back in. I guess I will donate this and buy a new rack from a different company making this a very expensive drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mansfield

product_meta.title: Honey-Can-Do Heavy Duty Gullwing Drying Rack, White Metal
product_meta.description: Style Name:Folding GullwingClean laundry is the name of your game. Now you can master more on your chore board with this Heavy-Duty Gullwing Clothes Drying Rack. Its 46-linear feet of drying area includes hanging space, a mesh shelf for sweaters and a shoe rack that keeps your kicks in shape while drying. It’s the best drying rack for protecting perfect pairs of blue jeans, delicate lingerie or vintage pieces from wear and tear of a dryer cycle—all while saving on energy costs. When you’re not using it, this portable drying rack neatly folds down to 3” flat for easy storage inside your laundry room, bedroom, or at your mom’s house.
feature_bullets: Foldable drying rack configures into six positions
46-linear feet of drying space folds flat for compact storage
Steel support arms handle heavy garments and large loads
Includes sweater shelf and shoe drying rack
Saves energy and extends life of clothes

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,076 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Shoe Drying, White, Honey-Can-Do Dry-01610 Heavy Duty Gullwing Drying Rack, 2-Pairs Of Shoe Holders, Multi-Use Sweater, 6 Position Wings Steel Support Arms
